Welcome to Express Users Sample dashboard

The simplest way to add multi user ability to an Express application.

{% if expressUsers.isAuthenticated %} This is the default template when a user connects to the application.
Simply replace it with your own by editing the page available at url /app. {% else %} This is the default template for the product landing page.
Simply replace it with your own by editing the page available at url /. {% endif %}

Out of the box account management

By default, Express Users provides all required pages to get started with users.

  • Login page
  • Register
  • View My Account
  • Edit My Account
  • Change My Password
  • Logout

Access users Informations In Templates

Current user is available in templates as expressUsers.

  • expressUsers.isAuthenticated: Is the user authenticated?
  • expressUsers.current: The current user object.
Sample

{% raw %} {%if expressUsers.isAuthenticated %} Connected as {{expressUsers.current.username}} {% else %} You are not logged in {% endif %} {% endraw %}

Results in

{%if expressUsers.isAuthenticated %} Connected as {{expressUsers.current.username}} {% else %} You are not logged in {% endif %}

Secure your routes

Once instanciated, the middleware provides a bunch of utility methods

  • requireAuthentication requires the user to be authenticated toaccess further controllers
  • requireSudo requires the user to enter its password again to access further middlewares
  • resetSudo reset current sudo rights
